transcript: I've done 291 200 calf raises in the last decade and that comes from training them every single day I work out four times a week for 52 weeks for a year for a decade now oh they just look like cabs they were the part of my body that were the most resistant to growth stimulus on the contrary like I don't train my chest at all I don't train my traps I don't train my abs because those have never been the constraint I've always had ABS my traps have always been fine my chest has always been fine and I put all of that effort into the constraint and so the idea is even though I have imbalanced effort in terms of where it's allocated the result is a more balanced physique 291 000 calf raises later I now have arthritis in my foot [Laughter]
